name: Baked Fish Croquettes
author: Gran28540
summary: These are delicate and soft fish croquette with a light crisp coating. I have used this recipe for leftover baked or broiled fish like salmon, steelhead trout, or other fish.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon seasoned salt, or more to taste
½ cup panko bread crumbs, or as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil
Discard skin, bones, and any crust from trout and flake fish with a fork
Combine flaked fish with soft bread crumbs, onion, mayonnaise, sour cream, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper in a bowl
Form mixture into balls and roll each ball in the panko
Arrange balls on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until croquettes are lightly browned and crispy, 15 to 20 minutes
